page.title: 07BRADES FARM:Farming Changes
page.content: During Mr Towers lifetime farming has become more intensive.Farmers now need to be more business-like and more tech- nical.Mr Towers learned farming through experience but one of his four sons attends agricultural college and two others have done so then gained experi- nce on other farms before returning to work at home.One specialises as a cow- man and the other deals with sheep and marketing.One other person is employed on the farm.Mr Towers has doubled his stock,uses less labour and more machin- ery.He buys a lot more feed and fertil- iser.He hopes to build a new computeri- sed herring bone milking parlour to re- place the rotary parlour.It will need only one man instead of two.He expects his cattle to stay inside longer.He ho- pes to employ more men so a shorter week can be established.As a family co- ncern members work longer hours.
